Class CSCD210Lab7Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd210Methods.CSCD210Lab7Methods

  • public class CSCD210Lab7Methods
extends java.lang.Object
    The CSCD210Lab7Methods class for Lab 7.

    Remember all parameters passed to methods will be final

    • Method Detail

      • readName

        public static java.lang.String readName(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readName method prompts the user to enter their name and reads the name from the keyboard. The method must ensure the name is not empty before it is returned. Empty is defined as nothing but the carriage return entered on the keyboard
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        String Representing the name of the person
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner object is null
        Post_Condition:
        The input buffer will be empty

      • readInfo

        public static double readInfo(java.util.Scanner kb,
                              java.lang.String type)
        The readInfo method prompts the user to enter their (height/weight) which is passed in as the String named type. Meaning type will be the word "height" or the word "weight". The height/weight is entered on the keyboard as a double. The method must ensure the height/weight is not less than or equal to 0
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        type - Representing the String height/weight
        Returns:
        double Representing the height/weight of the person
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner object is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type is empty
        Post_Condition:
        The input buffer will be empty

      • readInfo

        public static double readInfo(java.lang.String type,
                              java.util.Scanner kb)
        The readInfo method prompts the user to enter their (height/weight) which is passed in as the String named type. Meaning type will be the word "height" or the word "weight". The height/weight is entered on the keyboard as a double. The method must ensure the height/weight is not less than or equal to 0
        Parameters:
        type - Representing the String height/weight
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        double Representing the height/weight of the person
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner object is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type is empty
        Post_Condition:
        The input buffer will be empty
        Note:
        This method is overloaded and will simply call the other readInfo method

      • displayResults

        public static void displayResults(java.lang.String name,
                                  double height,
                                  double weight,
                                  double bmi)
        The displayResults method displays the persons name, weight, height, your BMI is theBMI you are underweight/normal/overweight/obese
        < 18.5 underweight
        < 25 normal
        < 30 overweight
        otherwise obese
        Parameters:
        name - Representing the String name
        height - Representing the double height
        weight - Representing the double weight
        bmi - Representing the double bmi
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String name is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String name is empty
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the height is less than or equal to 0
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the weight is less than or equal to 0
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the bmi is less than or equal to 0

      • goAgain

        public static boolean goAgain(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The goAgain method prompts the user to enter Yes/No to run the program again. The method must ensure the user enters yes or no (case insensitive).
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        boolean Representing true if the user entered yes otherwise false for no
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner object is null
        Post_Condition:
        The input buffer will be empty

      • calcBMI

        public static double calcBMI(double height,
                             double weight)
        The calcBMI method calculates the person's BMI. BMI is calculated by weight / (height * height) * 703
        Parameters:
        height - Representing the height
        weight - Representing the weight
        Returns:
        double Representing the BMI of the person
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the height is less than or equal to 0
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the weight is less than or equal to 0
